intro: Trichostemma hispidum, commonly known as the hairy starseed, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Loganiaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it produces small, capsule-like fruits. Trichostemma hispidum is often found in open woodlands and along mountain slopes.
